header.description: Labels for the main Direct Mail module

trans-unit.source: Enter the additional URL parameters used to fetch the HTML content from a TYPO3 page.
trans-unit.target: Enter the additional URL parameters used to fetch the HTML content from a TYPO3 page.

trans-unit.source: The specified parameters will be added to the URL used to fetch the HTML content of the direct mail from a TYPO3 page. If in doubt, leave it blank.
trans-unit.target: The specified parameters will be added to the URL used to fetch the HTML content of the direct mail from a TYPO3 page. If in doubt, leave it blank.

trans-unit.source: Default values for mail content format
trans-unit.target: Default values for mail content format

trans-unit.source: Default values for mail content fetching options
trans-unit.target: Default values for mail content fetching options

trans-unit.source: Default values for Direct Mails headers
trans-unit.target: Default values for Direct Mails headers

trans-unit.source: Default character set for direct mails built from external pages
trans-unit.target: Default character set for direct mails built from external pages

trans-unit.source: Specify the character set used in direct mails when they are built from external pages and character set cannot be auto-detected.
trans-unit.target: Specify the character set used in direct mails when they are built from external pages and character set cannot be auto-detected.

trans-unit.source: Select the default content transfer encoding of direct mails.
trans-unit.target: Select the default content transfer encoding of direct mails.

trans-unit.source: If mail content is protected by HTTP authentication, enter the password here.
trans-unit.target: If mail content is protected by HTTP authentication, enter the password here.

trans-unit.source: If mail content is protected by HTTP authentication, enter the username here.
trans-unit.target: If mail content is protected by HTTP authentication, enter the username here.

trans-unit.source: The username and password is used to fetch mail content. They are NOT sent in the mail! If you do not specify a username and password and the newsletter pages happen to be protected, an error will occur and no mail content will be fetched.
trans-unit.target: The username and password is used to fetch mail content. They are NOT sent in the mail! If you do not specify a username and password and the newsletter pages happen to be protected, an error will occur and no mail content will be fetched.

trans-unit.source: Set this option, to anonymize click statistics
trans-unit.target: Set this option, to anonymize click statistics

trans-unit.source: Options for content transfer encoding and character set
trans-unit.target: Options for content transfer encoding and character set

trans-unit.source: Options for links in mail content
trans-unit.target: Options for links in mail content

trans-unit.source: Check this option to enable jump URL's and the collection of click statistics.
trans-unit.target: Check this option to enable jump URL's and the collection of click statistics.

trans-unit.source: This configuration determines how QuickMails are handled and further sets the default value for Direct Mails.
trans-unit.target: This configuration determines how QuickMails are handled and further sets the default value for Direct Mails.

trans-unit.source: Enable jump URL's for mailto links:
trans-unit.target: Enable jump URL's for mailto links:

trans-unit.source: Check this option to enable jump URL's for mailto links.
trans-unit.target: Check this option to enable jump URL's for mailto links.

trans-unit.source: Enter the additional URL parameters used to fetch the plain text content from a TYPO3 page.
trans-unit.target: Enter the additional URL parameters used to fetch the plain text content from a TYPO3 page.

trans-unit.source: The specified parameters will be added to the URL used to fetch the plain text content of the direct mail from a TYPO3 page. If in doubt, set it either to '&type=99' or, when using TemplaVoila, to '&print=1'.
trans-unit.target: The specified parameters will be added to the URL used to fetch the plain text content of the direct mail from a TYPO3 page. If in doubt, set it either to '&type=99' or, when using TemplaVoila, to '&print=1'.

trans-unit.source: Specify the character set to use when sending quick mails.
trans-unit.target: Specify the character set to use when sending quick mails.

trans-unit.source: Select the content transfer encoding to use when sending quick mails.
trans-unit.target: Select the content transfer encoding to use when sending quick mails.

trans-unit.source: If mail content is protected by Frontend user authentication, enter the user group here.
trans-unit.target: If mail content is protected by Frontend user authentication, enter the user group here.

trans-unit.source: The usergroup with the uid specified is used to to fetch the mail content. If you do not specify a usergroup uid and the page has frontend user restrictions, an error will occur and no mail content will be fetched.
trans-unit.target: The usergroup with the uid specified is used to to fetch the mail content. If you do not specify a usergroup uid and the page has frontend user restrictions, an error will occur and no mail content will be fetched.

trans-unit.source: List of UID numbers of test recipient lists:
trans-unit.target: List of UID numbers of test recipient lists:

trans-unit.source: Alternatively to sending test-mails to individuals, you can choose to send to a whole list. This is the list of recipient lists UID numbers available for this action.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively to sending test-mails to individuals, you can choose to send to a whole list. This is the list of recipient lists UID numbers available for this action.

trans-unit.source: List of UID numbers of test recipients (tt_address):
trans-unit.target: List of UID numbers of test recipients (tt_address):

trans-unit.source: Before sending mails, you should test the mail content by sending test mails to one or more test recipients. The available recipients for testing are determined by this list of UID numbers. So first, find out the UID numbers (tt_address) of the recipients you wish to use for testing, then enter them here in a comma-separated list.
trans-unit.target: Before sending mails, you should test the mail content by sending test mails to one or more test recipients. The available recipients for testing are determined by this list of UID numbers. So first, find out the UID numbers (tt_address) of the recipients you wish to use for testing, then enter them here in a comma-separated list.

trans-unit.source: This will be prepended to the test newsletter subject
trans-unit.target: This will be prepended to the test newsletter subject

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of a custom-defined table, with compatible columns defined, which may also be used for direct mails distribution.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of a custom-defined table, with compatible columns defined, which may also be used for direct mails distribution.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Direct Mail from a page
trans-unit.target: Create a new Direct Mail from a page

trans-unit.source: Create a new Direct Mail from external URL
trans-unit.target: Create a new Direct Mail from external URL

trans-unit.source: Pages with HTML frames may not be fetched.
trans-unit.target: Pages with HTML frames may not be fetched.

trans-unit.source: Direct Mail scheduled task was not found!
trans-unit.target: Direct Mail scheduled task was not found!

trans-unit.source: If TYPO3 is not configured to automatically invoke the Mailer Engine, you can invoke it by clicking here:
trans-unit.target: If TYPO3 is not configured to automatically invoke the Mailer Engine, you can invoke it by clicking here:

trans-unit.source: You cannot create direct mails using pages that are hidden or access-restricted.
trans-unit.target: You cannot create direct mails using pages that are hidden or access-restricted.

trans-unit.source: Cannot edit - mail has been sent
trans-unit.target: Cannot edit - mail has been sent

trans-unit.source: Cannot edit - you don't have permissions to edit Direct Mails.
trans-unit.target: Cannot edit - you don't have permissions to edit Direct Mails.

trans-unit.source: This type of page cannot be used to create direct mails. Please select a regular page.
trans-unit.target: This type of page cannot be used to create direct mails. Please select a regular page.

trans-unit.source: The HTML content does not contain any direct mail boundaries.
trans-unit.target: The HTML content does not contain any direct mail boundaries.

trans-unit.source: The HTML content could not be fetched.
trans-unit.target: The HTML content could not be fetched.

trans-unit.source: The plain text content does not contain any direct mail boundaries.
trans-unit.target: The plain text content does not contain any direct mail boundaries.

trans-unit.source: The plain text content could not be fetched.
trans-unit.target: The plain text content could not be fetched.

trans-unit.source: Enter at least one valid URL!
trans-unit.target: Enter at least one valid URL!

trans-unit.source: Do not use a limit when sending
trans-unit.target: Do not use a limit when sending

trans-unit.source: Select a newsletter to continue sending:
trans-unit.target: Select a newsletter to continue sending:

trans-unit.source: Filter email dublettes from csv data. If a dublette is found, only the first entry is imported.
trans-unit.target: Filter email dublettes from csv data. If a dublette is found, only the first entry is imported.

trans-unit.target: No mapping is found. You have to map at least "email" field.

trans-unit.target: All necessary information for the import have been entered. By clicking on the "Import" button below, all data will be written in tt_address.
